intro: Gardenia macgillivraei, commonly known as the MacGillivray gardenia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its large, waxy, dark green leaves and its fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is evergreen and typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is noted for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
